intro: Inula falconeri, commonly known as the Falconeri's Inula, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a dense cluster of tiny disk flowers, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions with its compact growth habit. Inula falconeri is often found in rocky soils and is a hardy species that can withstand harsh mountain climates.
